text: Andrew Alexander "Spuds" Hebenton (October 3, 1929 - January 29, 2019) was a Canadian professional ice hockey right winger. He holds the record for the longest streak without missing a game in professional hockey history. He was born in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Hebenton played for the New York Rangers and Boston Bruins. He retired in 1976. Hebenton died on January 29, 2019 in Portland, Oregon from bladder cancer, aged 89.Obituary: Former NHL "Iron Man" Andy Hebenton Remembered As Hard Worker Gentlemen at Times Colonist ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1929 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Boston Bruins players Category:Cincinnati Mohawks (AHL) players Category:Deaths from bladder cancer Category:Canadian ice hockey left wingers Category:Ice hockey people from Manitoba Category:Lady Byng Memorial Trophy winners Category:New York Rangers players Category:Sportspeople from Winnipeg Category:Central Professional Hockey League players
title: Andy Hebenton
